sentence.Network_en: The President's speech was hailed as a conciliatory gesture toward business.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统的讲话被视为对商界的安抚性姿态，受到了欢迎。

sentence.Network_en: His comments to reporters were conciliatory in tone.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对记者们的讲话带着安抚的口吻。

sentence.Network_en: They approached the talks in a conciliatory spirit.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们抱一种和解的态度去参加谈判。

list.abs: the board has appointed two more conciliatory figures : Catherine Livingstone as chairman , and David Thodey , a Telstra insider , as chief executive .董事会已经任命了两名较温和的人物：凯瑟琳?利文斯通（CatherineLivingstone)担任董事长，一位澳州电信的内部人士大卫?托德利（DavidThodey)担任首席执行官。

I too will write them conciliatory words and offer dignities and gifts , so that they may be aid to me .我也要用委婉的言辞，许以地位和礼品，给他们写信，诱导他们也作我的助手。

but if both india and vietnam stand firm , they could force beijing to moderate its expansionist claims on the south china sea and adopt a more conciliatory stance on other regional matters .但如果印度和越南都坚定立场，那么他们可能会迫使中国缓和在南中国海问题上的扩张主义诉求，并在其他地区事务上采取更为妥协的立场。

entry.tran: 愿意和解的; 调停的;安抚的
entry.def: When you are conciliatory in your actions or behaviour, you show that you are willing to end a disagreement with someone.

example.ex: The next time he spoke he used a more conciliatory tone...
example.tran: 他再次开口时使用了更具安抚性的语气。

example.ex: The President's speech was hailed as a conciliatory gesture toward business.
example.tran: 总统的讲话被视为对商界的安抚性姿态，受到了欢迎。

means.word_mean: 1. making or willing to make concessions;

sentences.sentence: "loneliness tore through him...whenever he thought of...even the compromising Louis du Tillet"

auth_sentence.content: Sunday's victory speech was far more conciliatory.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sunday's victory speech was far more conciliatory.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sunday's victory speech was far more conciliatory.

auth_sentence.content: But the president's tone after the vote was not conciliatory.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the president's tone after the vote was not conciliatory.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the president's tone after the vote was not conciliatory.

auth_sentence.content: The conciliatory gestures come after a period of belligerence by Pyongyang.
auth_sentence.res_content: The conciliatory gestures come after a period of belligerence by Pyongyang.

stems_affixes.word_buile: conciliate[v.安抚,调和]+ory……的→adj.抚慰的, 调和的
con共同+cili召集+ate表动词→把人召到一起来→安抚[别人]

sentences.en: Everyone was in a conciliatory mood at the start of the meeting.
sentences.cn: 会议开始时，人人都抱着和解的想法。

sentences.en: The president’s speech was seen as a conciliatory gesture towards former enemies.
sentences.cn: 总统的讲话被看作是与昔日的敌人修好的表示。
